title: Is it Rotis Sans?
content:
Hey there,

I hope you can help me out. I’m looking for the font which is used in the attached sample. I think it’s a <cite>Rotis Sans</cite> however the ampersand does not match the <cite>Rotis Sans</cite> ampersand i know. Maybe a different ampersand is used, maybe it’s not a <cite>Rotis Sans</cite> at all. Voices in my head say that <cite>Lucas de Groot</cite> is somehow involved, however I cannot find anything <cite>LucasFonts-related</cite>. Any help is appreciated!

Cheers,  
Paul

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [rotiswannabe.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330183424/http:/typophile.com/files/rotiswannabe.jpg) | 7.33 KB |

 [‹ Help ID this script font - handwash label](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330183424/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41178 "Go to previous forum topic") [Name of these nike fonts ? ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330183424/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41099 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rabattski

comments.content: Your instincts were right. It’s definitely [Rotis Sans Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080330183424/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/agfa_rotis_65_sans_serif_bold/?sample_text=Salerooms%20Offices&sample_size=48&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1) which has a pretty nontraditional ampersand which they couldn’t handle, so substituted it with something else.
Ah, alright! Must say the ampersand used is quite a good one, good enough to throw me off the <cite>Rotis Sans</cite> hunch. Thanks for the help Stephen! Much appreciated.
looks like a ’gothic’ ampersand... franklin, news, something like that... must remember to use it next time i have to use rotis, i really hate its ampersand :-)
